intro: Dimorphotheca barberae, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a compact, bushy habit with hairy leaves. Its bright yellow to orange flowers bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Dimorphotheca barberae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
